item.description:
Kathleen Edwards’ 2003 debut, "Failer", led Rolling Stone to declare her one of the year’s most promising new acts and No Depression to say the release marked “the arrival of a rare talent.”

About her 2008 release, "Asking for Flowers", Rolling Stone said: "On her strongest album yet , she sets a poignant road tale between New York and Ontario ('Buffalo') and pens a fierce, Crazy Horse-ish squall about crack, murder and racism in her own back yard."

Described by some as a national treasure of Canada, she has been compared to Neil Young and Lucinda Williams.

Tupelo is a BYOB facility and has been voted best small venue in NH 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008.

See kathleenedwards.com for more info.

Youtube: Asking for Flowers

Austin City Limits: Kathleen Edwards

GA Tickets are $25 and available at www.tupelohall.com
item.how_to_find_us: I'll send out my cell# before the show
item.name: Kathleen Edwards @ Tupelo
